ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Horizontal Canal Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Indicated by geotropic direction-changing positional nystagmus, strongest in the head-left position, and horizontal left-beating nystagmus during left Dix-Hallpike.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Vestibular Migraine
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Supported by history of photophobia, headaches, anxiety, and concurrent symptoms; diagnosis of exclusion alongside BPPV.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Vestibular Neuritis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Ruled out due to lack of significant caloric weakness and presence of hearing preservation.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To evaluate hearing sensitivity given reports of otalgia, fullness, and tinnitus.
To assess speech understanding and agreement with pure-tone thresholds.
To evaluate retrocochlear pathology, though not completed in this case.
To evaluate for unilateral vestibular weakness.
To test for BPPV, specifically posterior canal involvement.
To evaluate for non-posterior canal BPPV or other positional nystagmus.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial audiological examination revealed normal hearing sensitivity and middle ear function, ruling out hearing loss as a contributor to the patient's symptoms despite reports of fullness and tinnitus.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally (0-15 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT in good agreement with PTA; WRS 100% bilaterally at 45 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal ear canal volume, middle ear pressure, and static compliance.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Vestibular evaluation indicated Horizontal Canal BPPV (left ear canalithiasis) based on geotropic direction-changing nystagmus strongest in the head-left position. Caloric testing was equivocal/normal, ruling out vestibular neuritis.

tests.name: Videonystagmography (VNG) - Caloric Testing
tests.result_summary: 21% left unilateral weakness (text describes as equivocal/insignificant); figure caption notes 27%.

tests.name: Dix-Hallpike
tests.result_summary: Right ear down unremarkable. Left ear down positive for horizontal left-beating nystagmus (no torsion).

tests.name: Positional Testing
tests.result_summary: Geotropic direction-changing nystagmus in all positions; strongest in head-left (60 deg/s horizontal component).

proposed_items: Lempert Roll (BBQ Roll) maneuver for left horizontal canal BPPV
Sleep in semi-upright position for two nights post-maneuver
Prescription of amitriptyline for migraine management
counseling_actions: Counsel on Horizontal Canal BPPV mechanism (loose crystals).
Discuss Vestibular Migraine and lifestyle/dietary triggers.

escalation.rationale_short: Patient managed by neurotologist for migraine medication and BPPV maneuvers.

follow_up_plan.objective: Assess resolution of headaches and positional vertigo; repeat maneuver if necessary.

expected_outcome: At 2-week follow-up: Headaches improved 90%, but some positional vertigo persisted; Lempert Roll was repeated.
At 1-month follow-up: Dix-Hallpike was negative in both directions with no further positional nystagmus.
Resolution of headaches reported as a result of taking amitriptyline.
